intro: Lijndenia acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandthorn, is a shrub native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and small, linear leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by small, spherical fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Lijndenia acuminata is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
